title.narrative: 1.1.5 : MALNUT PREVENTION, TREATMENT-SUR

description.narrative: By 2016, in all health prefectures, at least 80% of SAM cases are detected , referred, and treated according to the national protocols, undernutrition preventive activities are developed and nutritional surveillance and coordination systems are strengthened.â€ (2012-2014) By 2016, in the 13 targeted health prefectures, 100% of UNTA and UNT detect and treat cases of severe acute malnutrition according to the national protocols, activities for prevention of malnutrition are developed and a nutritional surveillance system is established., which contributes to Nutrition And Emergencies, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2016, at least 60% of girls and boys under-five and pregnant / lactating women use high impact gender-responsive integrated services (curative, preventive and promotional) in the country for an accelerated reduction of infant and under five mortality and maternal mortality.

sector.narrative: Capacity building for nutrition preparedness and response
HSS - Risk informed programming including climate resilience disaster and conflict

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2016, in all health prefectures, at least 80% of SAM cases are detected , referred, and treated according to the nationalprotocols, undernutrition preventive activities are developed and nutritional surveillance and coordination systems arestrengthened.? (2012-2014) By 2016, in the 13 targeted health prefectures, 100% of UNTA and UNT detect and treat cases of severeacute malnutrition according to the national protocols, activities for prevention of malnutrition are developed and a nutritionalsurveillance system is established.

description.narrative: Up to 23,954 (78.5 % of targeted) children 6-59 months with severe acute malnutrition were treated with a success rate of 89, 6%. Geographic coverage of nutrition services increased up to 18.2% through mobile and fixed strategy. CAR joined the SUN Movement and validated its food security and nutrition policy. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:15/01/2018
